H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H6793.def: = state in which the temperature of the atmosphere is relatively low

H5833.def: = action by which humans or deities provide assistance or support to (other) humans (in both military and non-military contexts) ► in order to make their life or work or task easier

H2595.def: = a long, straight rod, usually made of wood, with a sharp {L:iron<SDBH:בַּרְזֶל>} head or point; used for piercing by thrusting; its length varied from the height of a man to much longer

H5462.def: = causative action by which humans or deities close the entrance to a space with the help of a {L:door<SDBH:דֶּלֶת>}

H7122.def: = action by which humans or deities speak with a loud voice, often to draw attention to themselves or to their situation and expecting someone to respond in one way or another

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H1245.def: = action by which deities, humans, or animals make an intensive effort to locate (other) humans, animals, objects, or activities, which often requires them to move from one location to another

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H954.def: = state in which someone has forfeited the respect of the community, due to a situation that is not in accordance to someone's status

H3637.def: = state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H2659.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H4671.def: = debris and husks crushed and separated from grain and carried away by the wind when threshing and winnowing ≈ associated especially with the transient nature and disappearance of evil people and enemies.

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H2822.def: = state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

H2519.def: = state in which an object has a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations; ≈ often associated with danger and insincerity

H4397.def: = a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H7291.def: = action by which humans go behind (other) humans or animals, usually at an increased speed

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H2934.def: = action by which humans cause themselves to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined

H7568.def: = net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H2658.def: = action by which animals strike the ground with their feet

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H7568.def: = net of unknown size and shape; ► used for hunting birds and other animals, and also for fishing; ≈ associated with aggression and control

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H2934.def: = action by which humans cause themselves to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H3444.def: = causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success

H6106.def: = any of the pieces of hard, whitish material that together consitute the skeleton of humans and animals; ≈ associated with strength

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3644.def: = fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H5337.def: = causative action by which humans remove an object from a situation where it could be damaged

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H2389.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H1497.def: = action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H5707.def: = a person or deity who has evidence that something has taken place or that some decision has been made

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7908.def: = process by which humans lose one or more of one's offspring; ≈ sometimes associated with loneliness

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H2470.def: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances

H3830.def: = generic designation for any article of clothing

H8242.def: = relatively large receptacle ◄ made out of leather or cloth; ► used for the storage and transportation of food and possibly other objects as well

H6031.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H5315.def: = the part of the body connecting the head to the rest of the body and containing the passageways for blood, air, and food; ≈ associated with breathing, appetite, and life and often used metonymically to refer to the entire body and the personality inhabiting it

H6685.def: = action by which someone abstains from eating food, sometimes accompanied by mourning, prayer, and sacrifices, ◄ as a result of grief, repentance, or done as part of a ritual; ► its primary intention is to humble oneself before God and so be pleasing to him

H8605.def: = action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H2436.def: = front of the body of a human being, which, when a person is sitting down, forms a kind of platform that can be used for activities like throwing the lot, and that can even function as a sitting place for someone else, like a pet animal, a child or a beloved one; ≈ symbolizes affection and intimacy, and sometimes represents the entire person

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H6937.def: = process by which an object becomes dark in color

H57.def: = pertaining to being in a state of grief, caused by bereavement, loss, or other difficult circumstances, and which is shown by one's actions

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H8055.def: = state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H7167.def: = causative action by which humans or animals rip apart the human body or an inanimate object, either in part of entirely; usually with their hands

H2611.def: = state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

H3934.def: only used in poetry; = humans who express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H4580.def: = something cooked using dry heat on a hot surface

H2786.def: = to gnash or grind one's teeth עַל with regard to someone else ► in order to express one's hostility

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H7227.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H7169.def: = causative action by which humans press their lips together, ≈ which is associated with evil intent

H2803.def: = action by which humans exercise their {L:mind<SDBH:לֵב>} with regard to something

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

H7282.def: = state in which humans live in quiet confidence

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7337.def: = state in which an object is large in size

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H5782.def: = process by which someone wakes up from his sleep

H6974.def: = process by which humans open their eyes after sleep; ≈ also used in the figurative sense of becoming active after a period of inactivity, and of being restored to life after having died

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
